thread.title: Shah Rukh Khan condoles fan's demise during 'Raees' train promotion - Times of India
thread.title_full: Shah Rukh Khan condoles fan's demise during 'Raees' train promotion - Times of India

title: Shah Rukh Khan condoles fan's demise during 'Raees' train promotion - Times of India
text: Emotional Anil Kapoor breaks down at 'Mirzya' music launch event Shah Rukh Khan condoles fan's demise during 'Raees' train promotion After one person was killed and two policemen were injured as crowd went berserk when Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan arrived at Vadodara railway station, the actor said that he was "very sad" to learn about the tragedy. PTI | Updated: Jan 24, 2017, 12.03 PM IST VADODARA : After one person was killed and two policemen were injured as crowd went berserk when Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan arrived at Vadodara railway station, the actor said that he was "very sad" to learn about the tragedy. "It is unfortunate, my prayers are with the family of the deceased," the actor said when he arrived at Hazrat Nizamuddin railway station in Delhi at the end of his journey. Its unfortunate, my prayers are with the family of the deceased (died during commotion): SRK at Hazrat Nizamuddin railway station #Raees pic.twitter.com/KD89C7Kgcx — ANI (@ANI_news) January 24, 2017 SRK was travelling by August Kranti Rajdhani Express for promotion of his upcoming film 'Raees'. 'Raees' rail ride: Shah Rukh Khan halts to meet fans at Vadodara, Sunny Leone petrified by the frenzy Officials at the railway police control room in Vadodara had said, "At around 10.30 PM, the train arrived at platform number six of the station and halted for 10 minutes." "Shah Rukh's fans had gathered in large number to have a glimpse of the actor who had boarded the train from Mumbai and is going to Delhi as part of the promotional campaign for his film," railway police said. Raees: Shah Rukh Khan boards August Kranti Rajdhani from Mumbai to Delhi to promote his film "The crowd went berserk when the train halted and began banging its window panes and even falling on top of each other. Police had to resort to mild lathicharge to control the crowd. When the train started moving, people started running along with it. Due to the rush, one person died of breathlessness and two policemen posted there to control the crowd were injured," they said. Wanted to cover all cities in minimum time, so decided to travel by train. Also, I had not travelled in Indian Railways since long: SRK pic.twitter.com/hQZuG7HgFP — ANI (@ANI_news) January 24, 2017 Local authorities said the deceased has been identified as Farheed Khan Pathan, a local politician. The Bollywood superstar had boarded the train from Mumbai Central for Delhi as part of his promotional campaign 'Raees by Rail'. Cricketers Irrfan and Yusuf Pathan were also at the station to meet Shah Rukh Khan. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device. RELATED
